head.title: List of teams and cyclists in the 2017 Vuelta a España - Wikipedia

body.class: mediawiki ltr sitedir-ltr mw-hide-empty-elt ns-0 ns-subject page-List_of_teams_and_cyclists_in_the_2017_Vuelta_a_España rootpage-List_of_teams_and_cyclists_in_the_2017_Vuelta_a_España skin-vector action-view

div.h1: List of teams and cyclists in the 2017 Vuelta a España

div.p: The 2017 Vuelta a España was the 72nd edition of the race. It is the last of cycling's three Grand Tours to take place during the 2017 road cycling season. The race will start in Nîmes, France on 19 August and will finish in Madrid on 10 September.
All 18 UCI World Tour teams were automatically entitled to start the race.

The 18 UCI WorldTeams were automatically invited to participate in the Vuelta. In addition, the race organisers, invited four wildcard teams.[1] These included Caja Rural–Seguros RGA, the only Spanish-registered UCI Professional Continental team. Also invited were the French team Cofidis, Irish team Aqua Blue Sport and Colombian team Team Manzana Postobón.

tr.td: Starting number worn by the rider during the Vuelta
Deficit to the winner of the general classification
Denotes the winner of the general classification
Denotes the winner of the points classification

img.alt: White jersey with blue polka dots
img.title: Mountains classification

tr.td: Denotes the winner of the mountains classification
Denotes the winner of the combination classification
Denotes a rider who did not start, followed by the stage before which he withdrew
Denotes a rider who did not finish, followed by the stage in which he withdrew
Denotes a rider who was disqualified from the race, followed by the stage in which this occurred

td.i: Age correct as of 19 August 2017, the date on which the Vuelta begins

div.p: The following teams and cyclists took part in the 2017 Vuelta a España:[2]

a.title: 2017 Vuelta a España, Stage 1 to Stage 10
2017 Vuelta a España, Stage 1 to Stage 10
2017 Vuelta a España, Stage 1 to Stage 10

td.i: Directeur sportif: Steven De Jongh/Dirk Demol
Directeur sportif: Rik Van Slycke/Geert Van Bondt

Directeur sportif: Marc Reef/Arthur van Dongen

Directeur sportif: Eugenio Goikoetxea/Jose Miguel Fernandez
Directeur sportif: Luis Fernando Saldarriaga/Oscar de Jesús Vargas

div.p: The 198 riders that are competing in the 2017 Vuelta a España originated from 33 different countries.
